page.title: 16TREVERVA MALE VOICE CHOIR
page.content: The Treverva Male Voice is an important aspect of village life.The choir meets in Treverva chapel every Monday,7.00pm to 9.00pm.The age of singers ranges from twenty five to sixty five years old. The music is sung in four parts.These are Tenor,Second Tenor,Baritone & Bass.In the past they have sung in many famous places such as the Albert Hall. To join you will have to be interviewed by the conductor Edward Goldsmith.If you are accepted you will have many weeks singing in practices with the choir and if you pass the voice test with the musical director you will sing six months probation with the choir.
